subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: The Florida State offensive coordinator Jimbo Fisher said Sunday night that he will stay with the Seminoles, ending speculation that he could become the next coach at West Virginia.“I am a native of West Virginia and I love the state, but I want to make clear that I am staying at Florida State,” Fisher said in a statement.It was announced on Dec. 10 that the 42-year-old Fisher would become the head coach at Florida State after Bobby Bowden, who also had his contract extended for a year.
